titleInfo.title: Grafton Green, Chief Justice of Tennessee Supreme Court, between 1927 and 1946

mods.identifier: RG 412 Grafton Green Tenn Supreme Court 001

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Pictured: (left to right) Unidentified man, Grafton Green, C. J., James Clark McReynolds, Justice of U. S. Supreme Court, and Nashville attorney Percy D. Maddin, seated together at a banquet table. Grafton Green was an American jurist. He earned an LL. B from Cumberland School of Law at Cumberland University in 1893. Green practiced general law in Nashville until becoming a chief justice from 1923 to 1947, the longest tenure of any judge on the Tennessee Supreme Court. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission.
